metadata.title: 1994 Mitsubishi Lancer Evolution II GSR Lets You Live Your WRC Dreams
metadata.description: Don’t let the grocery-getter looks fool you, because this is a JDM homologation racer in sheep’s clothing.
metadata.author: Steven Symes

metadata.title: 1992 Mitsubishi Delica Is The Diesel 4X4 Van You Didn’t Know You Need
metadata.description: This unique JDM utility van will let you adventure with a low profile.
metadata.author: Steven Symes

sections: Modified for track use, this little JDM Honda can help you make some lasting memories.
Enjoying a cult following, the Honda CRX wasn’t a high-powered
by any stretch of the imagination. However, it offered
, low curb weight, excellent balance, and enough power to be entertaining. However, this
import Honda CRX SiR takes the intensity level up a few notches.
Even just a stock SiR has been forbidden fruit enthusiasts in America have lusted after for decades. This particular car has been legally imported, so while you’re probably going to want to
, you can register it and drive the car on public roads as well.

The biggest modification done to this CRX SiR is an engine swap. It’s now running a B20 block, however there’s a B16A head, or what this car came with from the factory. To keep those tires from spinning constantly, the previous owner had a limited-slip differential installed. You’ll note the aftermarket short-ram air intake is quite large. Also under the hood are wrapped headers, which bolt up to a full aftermarket exhaust system. A Link standalone ECU helps manage everything.

Moving to the cabin, a six-point roll cage is one of the first things to catch your eye. Another clear indication of the intentions of this build is the Bride racing seat on the driver’s side. Gauges have been added to the center stack, plus there’s a Personal steering wheel.

Good handling is key for really excelling at the track. While any CRX is already a natural for carving up any course, this one still has coilovers and 205/50 R15 Dunlop Direzza ZIIs. You’ll also note the AeroCatch hood pins.

While obviously not a show car, this Honda doesn’t look half bad for its age. The hood is a matte black, which prevents sun glare from blinding you while racing, plus it gives that edgy look some people really love. The red paint is in decent condition and appears to have a good shine. White Rays wheels are a nice touch.
If you have fond memories of your old Honda CRX, are interested in a JDM import, or have been searching for a unique yet affordable track car, this
might be the right fit. It’s listed through
so contact the dealer with specific questions.
